description: In this series we will dive into the second exam that is required for a viewer to achieve an MCSA in Windows 10. The topics will range from installation of Windows 10, post-installation configurations, applying images, various deployment tools as well as monitoring and servicing Windows 10 and more. Exam candidates are encouraged to watch both Windows 10 series for the MCSA exams.
descriptionMD: _This show is complete.  We are updating the recording to reflect new features and interface.  This one will be moved to Legacy when the updated version is complete._In this series we will dive into the second exam that is required for a viewer to achieve an MCSA in Windows 10. The topics will range from installation of Windows 10, post-installation configurations, applying images, various deployment tools as well as monitoring and servicing Windows 10 and more. Exam candidates are encouraged to watch both Windows 10 series for the MCSA exams.
name: MCSA Windows 10 - 70-698
subtitle: Installing and Configuring Windows 10

episodes.description: In this series we will dive into the second exam that is required for a viewer to achieve an MCSA in Windows 10. The topics will range from installation of Windows 10, post-installation configurations, applying images, various deployment tools as well as monitoring and servicing Windows 10 and more. Exam candidates are encouraged to watch both Windows 10 series for the MCSA exams.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:05.254
[NOISE] Hello, we're here to introduce
you to the Microsoft Windows

2
00:00:05.254 --> 00:00:10.496
10 (70-698) show that we're
about to begin recording.

3
00:00:10.496 --> 00:00:13.234
And what we want to do of course is
just talk about a few of these different

4
00:00:13.234 --> 00:00:15.260
elements that you'll end up seeing here.

5
00:00:15.260 --> 00:00:18.811
So here to help us out, we want to make
sure that we understand what's going on,

6
00:00:18.811 --> 00:00:20.370
so we have Mr. Wes Brian.

7
00:00:20.370 --> 00:00:23.720
Wes, tell us a little bit more
about who this exam is for, and

8
00:00:23.720 --> 00:00:25.140
what we're actually gonna be seeing.

9
00:00:25.140 --> 00:00:28.910
>> Very good, Ronny, actually one of the
things that you can expect is if you're

10
00:00:28.910 --> 00:00:34.060
looking at this content is it's really
focused on the certification, the exam.

11
00:00:34.060 --> 00:00:36.916
But we want you to keep in mind
that maybe you're not going for

12
00:00:36.916 --> 00:00:38.210
your MCSA in Windows 10.

13
00:00:38.210 --> 00:00:40.490
If you are,
then you're in the right place,

14
00:00:40.490 --> 00:00:42.960
because this is based on the second exam.

15
00:00:42.960 --> 00:00:45.130
You could be somebody that
maybe is an employer and

16
00:00:45.130 --> 00:00:48.270
you want to find out a little bit

17
00:00:48.270 --> 00:00:51.900
Or maybe you're in a help desk
support technician role right now and

18
00:00:51.900 --> 00:00:54.480
you want a little bit more
information about Windows 10.

19
00:00:54.480 --> 00:00:56.460
Well, this is a great place to do that.

20
00:00:56.460 --> 00:01:00.830
Keep in mind that two of these exams
kind of go together, and the content for

21
00:01:00.830 --> 00:01:01.830
them also go together.

22
00:01:01.830 --> 00:01:07.240
So we also have recorded the 7697, and
that is the first exam that you'll take

in the MCSA, and we definitely recommend
you going back and watching that,.

24
00:01:10.670 --> 00:01:15.910
And then coming back to the 7698 in
order to get the full benefit of what

25
00:01:15.910 --> 00:01:21.390
we offer as far as it comes to getting
certified for your MCSA in Windows 10.

26
00:01:21.390 --> 00:01:25.780
>> Now, Wes, what types of topics are we
really gonna be covering in this new show

27
00:01:25.780 --> 00:01:26.900
that we're about to begin?

28
00:01:26.900 --> 00:01:29.909
>> Well, if you've taken some
prior Windows certification exams,

29
00:01:29.909 --> 00:01:33.185
one of the things you might have noticed
is that they have a lot of local and

30
00:01:33.185 --> 00:01:36.269
enterprise level technologies that
they ask you questions about.

31
00:01:36.269 --> 00:01:39.995
This is a little bit of a stray
from the earlier format,

32
00:01:39.995 --> 00:01:45.260
in the fact that primarily they're
gonna be considering local management,

33
00:01:45.260 --> 00:01:48.100
right, locally taking care of Windows.

34
00:01:48.100 --> 00:01:51.250
However, you do have to keep in
mind that there will be some

35
00:01:51.250 --> 00:01:55.090
enterprise based technologies that
might make their way into the exam

36
00:01:55.090 --> 00:01:57.290
just as relevant to
managing Windows itself.

37
00:01:57.290 --> 00:02:00.004
So some of the things you can
look at is installation and

38
00:02:00.004 --> 00:02:01.480
the configuring of Windows.

39
00:02:01.480 --> 00:02:04.670
We'll take a look at things like
installations, local installations

40

primarily and then things like

41

We'll look at configuring the core

42

And again that's gonna be something
important, not only for the certification

43

endeavor, but also if you just want
more robust knowledge of Windows 10.

44
00:02:20.000 --> 00:02:23.013
We're primarily, and I wanna stress this,

45
00:02:23.013 --> 00:02:28.180
primarily we will be focused on local,
the local Windows operating system.

46
00:02:28.180 --> 00:02:31.630
And only really with
the enterprise level technologies

47
00:02:31.630 --> 00:02:34.190
that are found in the enterprise
where it applies.

48
00:02:34.190 --> 00:02:37.090
The other thing I want you to keep
in mind too is that in Windows 8.1,

49
00:02:37.090 --> 00:02:41.310
one of the things that it brought in was
integration with a few cloud services.

50
00:02:41.310 --> 00:02:43.840
So you can expect to a see a little
bit of that in Windows 10,

51
00:02:43.840 --> 00:02:46.630
primarily focused around
your Microsoft account.

52
00:02:46.630 --> 00:02:50.566
Something that they brought in,
an integration with a Microsoft account in

53
00:02:50.566 --> 00:02:54.807
Windows 8.1, we want you to know, that
that'll be one of the other things that

54
00:02:54.807 --> 00:02:58.019
you can expect inside of
the Windows 10 70-698 exam.

55
00:02:58.019 --> 00:03:00.823
>> So when we start to take
a look at this idea, then, Wes,

56
00:03:00.823 --> 00:03:05.040
what are some of the details that I need
to know if I'm ready to take the exam?

57
00:03:05.040 --> 00:03:07.610
>> Well, one of the things that
you can do is you can always go to

58
00:03:07.610 --> 00:03:08.840
Microsoft's website.

59
00:03:08.840 --> 00:03:10.530
In fact,
I've pulled it up here on my computer,

60
00:03:10.530 --> 00:03:13.390
to kinda give you guys a little
bit of an example of it.

61
00:03:13.390 --> 00:03:14.940
Here on my screen,
what I've gone ahead and

62
00:03:14.940 --> 00:03:18.560
did is I pulled up the Microsoft
website that it can show you

63
00:03:18.560 --> 00:03:21.930
a lot of the information that you
need to know about the 70-698 exam.

64
00:03:21.930 --> 00:03:26.488
I'll get that right here in bit.

65
00:03:26.488 --> 00:03:29.747
And it'll let you know, it'll let you
know a little bit about the format,

66
00:03:29.747 --> 00:03:30.950
the language types there.

67
00:03:30.950 --> 00:03:34.130
Keep in mind,
I believe there's more than one language,

68
00:03:34.130 --> 00:03:35.740
but definitely check that out.

69
00:03:35.740 --> 00:03:38.740
And it does show you that the audience
is geared around IT professionals.

70
00:03:38.740 --> 00:03:42.159
Keep in mind there's not a prerequisite,
although they will tell you that there

71
00:03:42.159 --> 00:03:45.990
are certain things that you really
should understand coming into this exam.

72
00:03:45.990 --> 00:03:49.160
One of the things that I'd like
to talk about, real briefly here,

73
00:03:49.160 --> 00:03:50.380
are some of the skills measured.

74
00:03:50.380 --> 00:03:53.328
It really boils down to three
different major domains, so

75
00:03:53.328 --> 00:03:56.696
the exam is kind of cut into thirds
in what you'll need to know, and

76
00:03:56.696 --> 00:03:58.755
they deviate a little bit here or there.

77
00:03:58.755 --> 00:04:00.719
You could say 30% or 35%,

78
00:04:00.719 --> 00:04:05.200
so it's really gonna be unique to
your question bank that you have.

79
00:04:05.200 --> 00:04:08.550
You can see some of the things that you're
gonna see here required implementing

80
00:04:08.550 --> 00:04:11.070
Windows, and then configuring
the core services like we said.

81
00:04:11.070 --> 00:04:15.940
And then finally managing and
maintaining those Windows machines.

82
00:04:15.940 --> 00:04:18.310
They also give you some
additional preparation options.

83
00:04:18.310 --> 00:04:21.060
Now, what if you're ready to
take the exam, how do you do it?

84
00:04:21.060 --> 00:04:22.432
Well you can go to Pearson Vue.

85
00:04:22.432 --> 00:04:26.490
Pearson VUE is the Microsoft authorized
testing platform if you will.

86
00:04:26.490 --> 00:04:29.040
A couple different ways that
you can get here if you know

87
00:04:29.040 --> 00:04:30.440
just go to this website really.

88
00:04:30.440 --> 00:04:34.520
Microsoft 70-698 website,
and if you schedule an exam,

89
00:04:34.520 --> 00:04:39.030
it's actually gonna flip you right
over to Pearson VUE's website.

90
00:04:39.030 --> 00:04:42.740
However, if you want, you can also go
directly to Pearson VUE website, and

91
00:04:42.740 --> 00:04:47.920
they can help you to locate your
authorized testing location so

92
00:04:47.920 --> 00:04:49.610
that you could schedule your exam.

93
00:04:49.610 --> 00:04:53.373
Keep in mind, it's something that
you wanna do, and you can see for

94
00:04:53.373 --> 00:04:56.874
US dollars at the time of this
recording it's about $165,

95
00:04:56.874 --> 00:04:59.273
you might have to adjust
that a little bit.

96
00:04:59.273 --> 00:05:03.637
So if the 70-698 certification is
something you decide that you wanna

97
00:05:03.637 --> 00:05:08.136
take well, this is where you can come to
get a little bit more information about

98
00:05:08.136 --> 00:05:10.750
this exam, and
we'd like to see you pass it.

99
00:05:10.750 --> 00:05:12.272
So get in there and study,

100
00:05:12.272 --> 00:05:15.673
but keep in mind we've got
a lot more Windows 10 to come.

101
00:05:15.673 --> 00:05:18.364
[NOISE]

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes describe how to prepare to implement Windows 10. They start by determining hardware requirements and compatibility. Then they help you choose between an upgrade or clean installation. Finally, they explain the difference between the Windows 10 editions, look at requirements for particular features, and create/use the appropriate installation media.
episodes.title: Implement Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain and demonstrate the steps necessary to install and configure Windows 10. They begin with a standard, clean installation. They show you how to prepare an old or new PC for receiving the Windows 10 operating system through backing up files (when applicable), determining the installation media type (DVD,USB,Network), configuring the hard disk, and then the actual OS install. They also begin their demonstration of a migration from previous versions of Windows.
episodes.title: Install Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue their demonstration of a migration from previous versions of Windows as well as taking you through an in-place upgrade; explaining each of the upgrade options so that you are able to choose the right upgrade for your environment.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes finish their demonstration of installing and/or upgrading to Windows 10 by showing you how to install additional Windows features and configuring Windows for additional regional and language support.
episodes.title: Install Windows Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes demonstrate how to use Microsoft's Native Boot feature for Windows 10. They start by explaining what Native Boot is and some of the scenarios where it might be implemented. Then they show you how to create and install the Virtual Hard Drive(VHD). This includes creating the VHDx file and applying an Image File to the VHD.
episodes.title: VHDs and Native Boot

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue demonstrating how to use Microsoft's Native Boot feature for Windows 10. Here they show you how to create a bootable WinPE ISO, during which they explain some considerations that may come into question during the process.
episodes.title: VHDs and Native Boot Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes expound on configuring devices, drivers, and post-installation options. They start by diving into the topic of signed and unsigned drivers. Then they move into downloading and/or importing driver packages. Finally, they discuss driver package management.
episodes.title: Devices and Drivers

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue to expound on configuring devices, drivers, and post-installation options. Here they demonstrate how to use the Deployment Image and Service Management(DISM) tool to add packages.
episodes.title: Devices and Drivers Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes take through the myriad of post-installation options and features in Windows 10. Here you'll see how to configure and customize options like the Start Menu, the Desktop, Taskbar, and the Action Center.
episodes.title: Post Installation Options

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue examining the cornucopia of post installation features and options in Windows 10. Here they look at configuring the Accessibility Features. They also dive into setting up Cortana as the personal assistant. Finally, they take you through configuring both the Edge and Internet Explorer 11 web browsers.
episodes.title: Post Installation Options Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes begin their demonstration of provisioning packages with the Imaging Configuration Designer(ICD). They begin by taking you through each necessary step to provision a package. From downloading the the ADK, building the package, and then configuring the provisioned package.
episodes.title: Provisioning Packages with ICD

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue their demonstration of provisioning packages with the Imaging Configuration Designer(ICD). They pick back up by showing you how to mount/unmount their newly created image file. Finally, they apply the provisioned package to a PC.
episodes.title: Provisioning Packages with ICD Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes introduce you to volume activation for Windows 10 clients in an Active Directory domain using the Microsoft Key Management System(KMS). They also show you how to configure and optimize the User Account Control(UAC) using Group Policy.
episodes.title: Windows in an Enterprise Environment

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike talk about configuring networking and how to troubleshoot network connections. They examine command line utilities like ipconfig, ping, netstat, tracert, and route print. They also demonstrate some PowerShell cmdlets like Get-NetIPAddress, Get-NetRoute, and Test-Connection.
episodes.title: Configure Networking

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike continue their discussion on establishing and troubleshooting network connections. They start with some utilities like netsh, nslookup, and Resolve-DNSName. Then they look at VPN connections and demonstrate setting up App-triggering VPN connections.
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike wrap up their look at configuring networking with a look at DirectAccess. They discuss all of the components that make up a DirectAccess solution, explaining where they are deployed on the network and their function. They explain how DirectAccess works, determining the users location and building the tunnels.
episodes.title: Configure Networking Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain and demonstrate how to configure storage devices in a Windows 10 environment. They begin by configuring both Basic and Extended disk partitions; then jumping into Dynamic disks all the while explaining their differences and limitations.
episodes.title: Configure Storage

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue their discussion on storage management in Windows 10. They jump back into Dynamic Disks, using PowerShell to create, convert, and configure disk partitions and volumes. They also explain the differences between the Simple/Striped/Spanned/Mirrored volume types.
episodes.title: Configure Storage Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes show how to implement and configure storage in Windows 10.  In this third part, they focus in on how to format volumes and manipulate file attributes via the command line interpreters, respectively.  The guys talk about Storage Spaces.  This feature, Wes explains, gives Windows users the ability to aggregate diverse and multiple disparate storage devices, in bulk or incrementally, depending on how it’s configured. They also show some of the different configurations possible when configuring “Storage Spaces”.
episodes.title: Configure Storage Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes take a look at how to implement apps from the Command Line Interpreter.  They demonstrate some of the options an enterprise support should know when installing or uninstalling apps.  These command line options are needed when deciding to create installation scripts for deploying apps across an enterprise, according to the guys.  Wes also introduces some of the different options that can be configured to startup the Windows 10 computer for troubleshooting.
episodes.title: Implement Apps

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes take a look at how to create and build the Windows Store for our enterprise usage.  The Windows Store for business can be configured so that our enterprise can effectively deploy and control apps, according to the guys.  They show how to add an app or deploy an app to an user within the enterprise and how to assign different roles to administrate the enterprise’s Windows Store.
episodes.title: Windows Store for Business

episodes.description: in this episode, Ronnie and Wes show how to configure remote management tools in Windows 10.  They demonstrate using the Windows Remote Management from PowerShell and options needed to enable the proper service as well as disable it.  The guys also show how to use the powerful PS REMOTING to run cmdlets on a remote machine too.  Wes shows how to use these tools to get information from the remote system accessed.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes continue to show the additional remote management using the microsoft management console to connect and manage operating system services and features on remote systems.  They briefly also mention the usage of Remote Desktop Connection and the use of Easy Connect.  With Easy Connect, they emphasize the requirements needed to make this feature work for the Windows 10 Enterprise Support Technician.
episodes.title: Configure Remote Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes explain configuring Updates in Windows 10. They start by looking at the classic servicing model and then compare that to the new update deployment model. Next they discuss Windows as a Service(WaaS) for managing updates. Finally, they show you how to use Group Policy to set Update policy.
episodes.title: Configure Updates

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes show how to configure monitoring tools built into Windows 10 and verify that they are working.  The start by demonstrating the different logs found in the Event Viewer and how to verify that the logs are working.  They also show how to configure Event Subscriptions.  They also show the improved task manger tabs and the detailed information it how can show a technician.
episodes.title: Monitoring Windows

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes continue to show some other monitoring tools available in Windows 10. They also demonstrate the real time resource usage and realtime performance monitoring Windows 10 can do.  They also show the ability to create data collector sets, this allows for collecting data over time for comparison basis.  The guys also show how to install, monitor and manage printers and print jobs, respectively.   All these tools are not additional tools but built in tools to demonstrate the completeness of Windows 10 to help the technician support this operation system.
episodes.title: Monitoring Windows Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes continue looking at monitoring features found in Windows 10. Here they explore how to configure the indexing options, Windows Defender, the Reliability Monitor, and the Performance Monitor.
episodes.title: Monitoring Windows Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes demonstrate using some of the advanced management tools available in Windows 10. They begin by showing you how to manage system services using the GUI as well as the Command Prompt and/or Powershell.
episodes.title: Advanced Management Tools

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Wes finish their exploration of some of the Advanced Management Tools in Windows 10. Here they demonstrate working with the Device Manager to upgrade or change a device driver. Then they show you how to create a custom Microsoft Management Console(MMC) and automate tasks with the Task Scheduler and Powershell.
episodes.title: Advanced Management Tools Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Wes discuss the need and show how to run a complete file system backup in Windows 10.  The guys show that Windows 10 doesn’t have a native application for backing up the file system through the GUI.  Instead, Windows 10 provides the Backup and Recovery tool from Windows 7 to provide a complete backup and create a system image so that even a full bare metal recovery could be accomplished.  The guys show how to create a backup using WBAdmin and using the System Backup and Recovery from Windows 7.
episodes.title: Configure System and Data Recovery

episodes.description: In this episode, Wes and Mike discuss supporting device security. They start by explaining Device Guard and how it controls the applications that are allowed to run. Then they look at Credential Guard, and talk about how it keeps user credentials safe. They finish with a discussion on Device Health Attestation, and how Secure Boot and Measured Boot work to protect the system.
episodes.title: Supporting Device Security

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at how to join devices to Azure AD. They demonstrate performing an Azure AD Domain Join on a Windows 10 PC.
episodes.title: Azure AD Domain Join

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike configure Dynamic Lock. They demonstrate how you can use a Bluetooth paired device to lock your Windows 10 PC when the paired device is out of range.
episodes.title: Configure Dynamic Lock

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Mike look at the MDM Migration and Analysis tool. They demonstrate how it can be used to help migrate from using GPO's to manage devices to using MDM platforms like Intune. They show how to install and run the tool, as well as look at the reports generated.
episodes.title: MDM Migration and Analysis Tool
